tournament.name: MTG SEA Championship Final - Oracle Events

decks.notes: The key concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful threats. By controlling the board and the opponent's resources, the deck aims to slowly grind out a victory by efficiently dealing with threats and maintaining card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog provides powerful finishers to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. Additionally, the deck has a versatile sideboard to adapt to different matchups and strategies.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while applying pressure through aggressive creatures and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt your opponent's hand and board, along with creatures like Flickerwisp and Solitude to control the battlefield, you can slowly grind out your opponent's resources while developing your own board presence. With a mix of efficient removal spells and resilient creatures, this deck aims to outvalue your opponent and secure victory through a combination of disruption and aggression.

The deck revolves around the combination of Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to quickly ramp up mana and search for important lands like Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. The deck also utilizes cards like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble for additional win conditions. It includes other ramp cards like Arboreal Grazer and Cultivator Colossus to speed up the process. Additionally, the deck focuses on land recursion and manipulation with cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Vesuva. Overall, the key strategy is to quickly assemble powerful land combinations to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces needed to utilize Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to loop through the deck, generating infinite mana and storm count to win the game with Grapeshot. Emry and Tamiyo help to dig through the deck for the combo pieces, while disruption spells like Spell Snare and Lightning Bolt provide protection and removal. The mana acceleration from Mox Opal and Mox Amber, along with the value from Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga, help to set up the combo quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on using powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, Territorial Kavu, and Scion of Draco to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. It also includes spells like Lightning Bolt, Consign to Memory, and Tribal Flames to deal direct damage and control the board. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide additional support for the aggressive creatures. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to the different colors needed for the spells and creatures in the deck.

The deck focuses on using Emry, Lurker of the Loch to repeatedly loop powerful spells and artifacts from the graveyard with Underworld Breach. This combo synergizes well with cards like Grinding Station and Mishra's Bauble to generate value and eventually win the game through either storming off with Grapeshot or using Jace, Wielder of Mysteries to draw the entire deck. Urza's Saga provides additional artifact support, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps with card selection. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

This deck aims to use a combination of creatures and spells to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures, then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield at once. The deck includes cards like Shardless Agent and Subtlety to cascade into Living End, along with creatures like Curator of Mysteries and Waker of Waves to contribute to the graveyard. With a mix of control elements like Force of Negation and Endurance, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent while setting up for a powerful Living End combo finish.

The main concept of this deck is to use the interaction between Deceiver Exarch and Splinter Twin to create infinite copies of Deceiver Exarch, resulting in an overwhelming board presence and allowing for a quick win through combat damage or other means. The deck also utilizes counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the game until the combo can be assembled. Additionally, cards like Magus of the Moon and Thundertrap Trainer disrupt opponents' game plans and further enhance the deck's strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing various land-based combos to ramp up quickly and put powerful threats onto the battlefield. The key strategy involves using cards like Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to generate immense mana and land advantage, allowing for explosive plays like casting multiple Scapeshifts to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. With the right setup, this deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with its efficient land ramp and combo potential.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly and efficiently deal damage to the opponent using a combination of powerful creatures and burn spells. The deck is designed to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintain that pressure throughout. Cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Seasoned Pyromancer provide card advantage and board presence, while cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment help finish off the opponent. The deck also includes disruption elements like Static Prison and March of Otherworldly Light to control the board and give the aggro strategy an edge.

The deck focuses on using the powerful combo of Emry, Lurker of the Loch, Grinding Station, Mishra's Bauble, and Underworld Breach to create a loop that allows for milling and recursion, ultimately leading to victory through cards like Jace, Wielder of Mysteries or Grapeshot. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Urza's Saga provide additional value and card advantage, while Mox Opal and Mox Amber help to ramp and fix mana. The key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces as quickly as possible and disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up for a lethal finish.

This deck focuses on using cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to enable the powerful interaction between Grinding Station and Underworld Breach. By repeatedly casting spells from the graveyard and sacrificing artifacts, players can generate infinite mana and mill their opponent out with Grapeshot or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Pithing Needle and Soul-Guide Lantern to disrupt opponent's game plans and protect its own combo.

The key strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt opponents with a combination of hand disruption, counterspells, and removal spells while gradually gaining card advantage and board control. By efficiently dealing with threats and controlling the game, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and eventually close out the game with powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and control elements like Subtlety. The deck also focuses on manipulating the opponent's deck and hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to maintain control over the game's pace.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies while maintaining control of the game through counterspells, removal spells, and graveyard hate. It also utilizes creatures with disruptive abilities to control the board and protect itself. The deck includes a diverse range of cards to deal with various threats and maintain card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent access to its spells. Overall, the deck's goal is to control the flow of the game and outvalue the opponent through efficient removal and card advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Street Wraith, Burning Inquiry, and Faithless Looting to power out big threats like Hollow One, Vengevine, and Ox of Agonas. The key strategy is to discard cards aggressively to generate early threats and put pressure on the opponent while using cards like Flameblade Adept and Lightning Bolt to control the board. Marauding Mako can also help push damage through and close out games quickly. The use of Arena of Glory can help boost the deck's aggression and provide extra damage output.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with disruptive creatures and spells while applying constant pressure with aggressive threats. By combining aggressive creatures like Boggart Trawler and Overlord of the Balemurk with disruptive cards like Solitude and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while slowly chipping away at their life total. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Relic of Progenitus and Dauthi Voidwalker to disrupt the opponent's graveyard strategies, further increasing its disruptive capabilities.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a mix of artifacts and creatures. It uses cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to generate mana and draw cards efficiently. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Memory Guardian help recur artifacts from the graveyard for repeated value. Urza's Saga is a powerful engine in the deck, allowing for the quick deployment of threats. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Metallic Rebuke and Portable Hole to control the board and protect its key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and resilient.

The main strategy of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to cast powerful creatures like Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus. The deck also includes multiple ways to search for key lands like Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal damage to the opponent. With the ability to generate large amounts of mana and tutor for specific key cards, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and potent combo interactions.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. Utilizing powerful creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with support cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from the beginning of the game. Cards like Guide of Souls and Ranger-Captain of Eos help in maintaining card advantage and consistency, while Static Prison and Arena of Glory provide control and protection. The deck is designed to quickly take control of the game and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on using Underworld Breach to generate infinite mana and recur key combo pieces from the graveyard. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help to filter through the deck and find the combo pieces. Grinding Station is used to mill the opponent's deck once the combo is assembled, with the win condition being Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells and removal spells to protect the combo while setting up the win condition. The lands are carefully chosen to support the combo and provide necessary colors for the spells.

The deck focuses on using Underworld Breach to recur powerful spells from the graveyard, eventually leading to a game-winning combo with Grinding Station and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. It also includes cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Mishra's Bauble for card advantage and utility, as well as disruptive elements like Urza's Saga and Malevolent Rumble. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy using counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It also utilizes creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Murktide Regent to apply pressure and close out the game. The deck aims to maintain a strong control over the game's pace by efficiently answering threats and denying the opponent resources to establish their game plan. It is designed to be reactive and adaptable to a variety of strategies while establishing its own win condition through efficient card advantage and threat management.

Utilizing a variety of counter spells, removal, and card advantage, this Dimir Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly building up its own resources. By efficiently dealing with threats and drawing cards, this deck can control the pace of the game and eventually establish a powerful board presence with creatures like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters. The deck is designed to outlast the opponent and grind out victories through control of the battlefield.

The main focus of the deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Kozilek, the Great Distortion. These creatures are supplemented by control elements such as Kozilek's Return and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes various support cards like Malevolent Rumble and Sowing Mycospawn to further control the board and maintain an advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while keeping control of the game.

The deck focuses on using ramp spells like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to accelerate into powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also utilizes control elements with cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Karn, the Great Creator is used to tutor for important artifacts to further control the board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats while staying alive through disruption and control elements.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through ramp spells to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and control spells. The Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and World Breaker provide massive threats for the opponent, while cards like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble help to control the board. The deck also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator to further control the game. The combination of ramp, control, and powerful creatures creates a strategy that overwhelms the opponent and allows for a strong late-game presence.

This deck focuses on using a combination of creatures and spells to quickly assemble a powerful win condition without relying on lands. By utilizing cards like Thundertrap Trainer, Lotus Bloom, and Disrupting Shoal, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up for a game-winning play with cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Hydroelectric Specimen. With access to counterspells like Pact of Negation and disruption tools like Sink into Stupor, this deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with a burst of powerful combo plays.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and put pressure on the opponent. By using cards like Solitude and Ephemerate to remove threats, along with cards like Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's graveyard, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence while slowing down the opponent's game plan. With a focus on efficient removal and disruption, the deck seeks to outpace the opponent and secure victory through calculated plays and strategic use of its tools.

This deck focuses on using a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and dismantle the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Solitude to apply pressure, while also disrupting the opponent's graveyard with Relic of Progenitus and Thoughtseize, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate provide added versatility and synergy with the deck's creatures. The key strategy is to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a win.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck also utilizes cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to gain value from entering the battlefield triggers and to control the board. The deck's strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's resources and tempo while maintaining a strong board presence with creatures like Ketramose, the New Dawn and Overlord of the Balemurk. It aims to apply pressure early and close out the game quickly.

The main idea of this deck is to mill the opponent's library as quickly and efficiently as possible by utilizing cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, Archive Trap, and Glimpse the Unthinkable. The deck also includes disruption cards like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch to control the board and prevent counterplay. The combo aspect comes from the synergy between milling cards and cards like Tasha's Hideous Laughter or Jace, the Perfected Mind to mill large amounts of cards at once. Surgical Extraction is included to remove key cards from the opponent's graveyard to disrupt their strategy.

This deck aims to win by milling the opponent's deck as quickly as possible, using cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, and Fractured Sanity to mill cards from the opponent's library. It also includes cards like Archive Trap and Surgical Extraction to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck runs a few counterspells like Drown in the Loch for protection and Tasha's Hideous Laughter as a potential finisher. Jace, the Perfected Mind can help with card advantage, while Crypt Incursion provides some lifegain against aggressive decks. The land base includes fetch lands and utility lands to ensure consistent mana production.
